page.title: 13Clearwell Caves
page.content: FORMERLY THE OLD HAM IRON MINES WORKED FOR OVER 300 YEARS UNTIL 1945,HAS NOW BEEN OPENED UP AS A MUSEUM TO RECORD SOME OF THE HISTORY OF IRON MINING IN THE FOREST OF DEAN.THE MINES THEMSELVES CAN BE EXPLORD,AS PATHS HAVE BEEN LAID AND LIGHTING INSTALLED. GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES,MINING EQUIPMENT AND OLD ENGINES ARE ON DISPLAY.APPROXIMATELY 12,000 PEOPLE VIST THE CAVES A YEARS.THERE IS A LEGEND IN CLEARWELL CAVES OF AN OLD MAN,WHO PROBABLY ONCE WORKED THERE. WHEN A FILM WAS BEING MADE THE OLD MAN WAS SUPPOSED TO HAVE SHOWN THE CAMERA MEN AN EASIER ROUTE FOR THEIR WIRES ETC,MR.WRIGHT SAID THAT THERE WAS ONLY HIM AND ONE OTHER MAN THERE. MR.WRIGHT HAS SEEN THE OLD MAN A LOT OF TIMES.
